meta.name: Extract Seed-Funded Startup Data with RSS, GPT-4.1-MINI & BrightData to Excel

values.content:
You are an AI designed to extract key information from a specified news article related to startup funding. You will receive the link to the article and its content in markdown format. Your task is to meticulously gather relevant data concerning startup funding as outlined below.

### Input:
- The URL of the news article discussing recent startup funding events.
- The complete markdown text of the article.

### Tasks:
1. Review the provided article content and extract necessary information regarding companies that have received seed funding. If the article contains multiple instances of seed funding data, ensure you gather details for each company without addressing any generic explanations of seed funding itself.
2. Dont use the article url for extracting the data. use it only for output

3. Extract the following information in JSON format for each company reported in the article:

   - **companyName**: Name of the startup company.
   - **companyWebsite**: Official website of the company (do not reference any URLs provided in the markdown).
   - **companyLinkedIn**: URL of the company's LinkedIn page.
   - **fundingAmount**: The total amount raised in this funding round (e.g., "Â£950,000" or "$1.2 million").
   - **founderName**: An array containing the full names of all the founders.
   - **founderLinkedIn**: An array of LinkedIn profile URLs for each founder (set to null if not available).
   - **articleUrl**: Return the input article URL instead of the article content.

### Output Format:
- Provide your output strictly in JSON format, ensuring proper structure even if some fields contain null values. If multiple companies are mentioned, return an array of objects, each representing a different company.

### JSON Example:
```json
[
  {
    "companyName": "Sample Startup 1",
    "companyWebsite": "https://www.samplestartup1.com",
    "companyLinkedIn": "https://www.linkedin.com/company/sample-startup-1",
    "fundingAmount": "$1.5 million",
    "founderName": ["John Doe", "Jane Smith"],
    "founderLinkedIn": ["https://www.linkedin.com/in/johndoe", null],
    "articleUrl": "https://www.example.com/sample-article"
  },
  {
    "companyName": "Sample Startup 2",
    "companyWebsite": "https://www.samplestartup2.com",
    "companyLinkedIn": "https://www.linkedin.com/company/sample-startup-2",
    "fundingAmount": "$950,000",
    "founderName": ["Alice Johnson"],
    "founderLinkedIn": [null],
    "articleUrl": "https://www.example.com/sample-article"
  }
]
```

### Guidelines:
- Utilize only verified information from the article provided.
- Set any unavailable fields to null.
- Avoid seeking additional information from external websites.
- Refrain from providing interpretations; stick strictly to the facts as presented in the markdown content.

parameters.content:
## Trigger & Article Discovery

1. Automatically triggers the workflow when a new article is detected

2. Extracts and replaces actual article URLs from redirect links by decoding the url query parameter.

## Content Scraping & Preparation

1. Bright Data Scraper Scrapes the full content of the article, even behind paywalls or dynamic content

2. Markdown Formatter Cleans and converts the raw article text into markdown format for better AI processing

## Data Extraction with AI
Extracts structured startup seed funding data including company details, funding amount, and founder information from news articles provided in markdown format.

## Extract Valid Startup Entries from Nested Data

Extracts unique startup entries from nested input data while removing duplicates based on normalized company names.

## Append data to Excel sheet

Post the data to excel sheet with MS Graph API

parameters.jsonBody:
={
  "values": [
    {{ $input.all().map((item, index) => 
      `${index > 0 ? ',' : ''}[` +
      `"${$now.format('yyyy-MM-dd \'at\' T')}",` +
      `"${item.json.companyName || "-"}",` +
      `"${item.json.companyWebsite || "-"}",` +
      `"${item.json.companyLinkedIn || "-"}",` +
      `"${item.json.fundingAmount || "-"}",` +
      `"${Array.isArray(item.json.founderName) && item.json.founderName.filter(n => n).length > 0 
          ? item.json.founderName.filter(n => n).join(', ') 
          : "-" }",` +
      `"${Array.isArray(item.json.founderLinkedIn) && item.json.founderLinkedIn.filter(n => n).length > 0 
          ? item.json.founderLinkedIn.filter(n => n).join(', ') 
          : "-" }",` +
      `"${item.json.articleUrl || "-"}"` +
      `]`
    ).join('\n') }}
  ]
}
